definition: lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
tears and mucus flowing profusely (idiom); weeping tragically
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
to sift chaff/(fig.) to shake all over
to bump one's head/to kowtow with head-banging on the ground
